definition: Paul (name)
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
thus/so/like that/you/thou
Paulson or Powellson (name)/Henry (Hank) Paulson (1946-), US banker, US Treasury Secretary from 2006

sentences.english: But Mr. Paulson insists that he wants a “clean” plan.
sentences.chinese: 但是保爾森先生堅持他想要一個“乾淨”的方案。

sentences.english: Paul was badly injured when his car was in head-on collision with a bus.
sentences.chinese: 保爾的汽車同一輛公共汽車迎頭相撞時，受了重傷。

sentences.english: Poulter recalls the sense of being on the outside looking in.
sentences.chinese: 保爾特回憶起他在外觀賽的感受。

sentences.english: V. S. Naipaul is an important modern writer of post-colonial literature.
sentences.chinese: 奈保爾是當代後殖民文學的重要作家。

sentences.english: Paul chips approach shot onto green and close to flag.
sentences.chinese: 保爾近穴擊球，球落在了果嶺靠近旗杆處。

sentences.english: People in backstreet will remind us of the characters in Naipaul's novel "Miguel Street".
sentences.chinese: 后街的一切讓人想起奈保爾《米格爾街》中的人物。

sentences.english: Going into the weekend, Paulson made a three-part gamble.
sentences.chinese: 到週末時，保爾森進行了一個由三部分組成的賭博。

sentences.english: In a fishing, Paul made forestry official daughter dounia.
sentences.chinese: 在一次釣魚的時候，保爾結識了林務官的女兒冬妮婭。

sentences.english: She had so loved Pavel Korchagin, a son of impoverished family.
sentences.chinese: 她曾經那樣地熱愛窮人的兒子保爾。
現在，奈保爾有了他豐碑式的正傳。

sentences.english: These were the investments Paulson wanted included in a new DDO.
sentences.chinese: 保爾森希望把這些投資納入一款新DDO。

sentences.english: Paul and Rachel are blameless tourists.
sentences.chinese: 瑞秋和保爾都是無辜的旅遊者。

sentences.english: The Treasury secretary says he hopes for congressional approval next week.
sentences.chinese: 保爾森說，他希望下星期能獲得國會的批准。

sentences.english: Paulson supports the principle-based approach, to a degree.
sentences.chinese: 在某種程度上，保爾森支持採用原則性監管體制。

definition: drugs test (e.g. on athletes)
Jean-Paul Sartre (1905-1980), French existential philosopher and novelist

Nelson or Nillson (name)/Horatio Nelson (1758-1805), British naval hero
Goliath
Robertson (name)
Dole (name)/Bob Dole (1923-), US Republican politician, Kansas senator 1969-1996
to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
Zhongwei prefecture level city in Ningxia
visiting team (sports)
(med.) cerebral concussion
(math.) higher dimensional
Milton (name)/John Milton (1608-1674), English republican writer and poet, author of Paradise Lost
Pope Vigilius (in office 537-555)/phonetic -vich or -wich in Russian names
grand duchy
Kohl (name)/Helmut Kohl (1930-2017), German CDU politician, Chancellor 1982-1998
